answers.answer: He will be fine no reason to worry, I am sure doctor will put him on antivirals (medications) until the number becomes low again or undectable..mines was not actives either but later became and I was put on antivirals, jusr think of it as diabetes, you can manage it and treat it and live a long happy life..if you go on medications there is a likely chance it can be inactive again
dont worry about viral load, it will come down, please careful    other medications usd. this may rise SGPT
You must test his hbvdna, and also his HbeAg status to give a better picture of his conditions.

question: Hi,Need some guidance on my husband's condition. We came to know about his Hep B about 2 years back. As per all the tests done, he has this condition since birth. The hbv DNA was undected initially which changed last year. But his fibroscan and LFT were within limits, so doc didn't start his medication. We were asked to regularly monitor sgpt sgot levels. Now last month his sgpt sgot shot above the range, sgpt at about 80. Doc asked us to redo the test to make sure it was not an aberration. Now it came out too high this time with sgpt at 850+. We r meeting the doctor early this week.With your experience, would you please guide us. Would be really greatful.
title: Chronic Hepatitis B case with too high sgpt sgot
